conclusion: Analyze the image and apply mechanics to find the mass of block B.
Mechanical setup with a 30° inclined ramp and a pulley system. Rope connected to block A at the top and block B at the bottom, forming a 90° angle at the pulley.
Setup involves two blocks, A and B, connected by a rope through a pulley.
Rope is at a 90° angle with the horizontal at the pulley.
Tension (T) in the rope is the same on both sides due to the 90° angle.
Block A is on an inclined plane with a 30° angle. Gravity on block A is mg.
Component of gravity pulling block A down the incline is mg sin(30°).
For block A to remain stationary, tension T must balance this component: T = mg sin(30°).
Tension is the same on both sides of the pulley, so T = mg sin(30°) is also the tension pulling block B.
Mass of block B is equal to the tension: mB = T = mg sin(30°).
Sine of 30° is 0.5, so mB = mg × 0.5 = 0.5m.
